727397f-b.text:
Metropolitan Avenue, (poles thereon) at the N.E. corner of Seventy-first avenue (left not constructed) showing in 4 views the A. Hegemony farmhouse of 1852. Mr. Hendrickson owned it from 1860-1873. Other owners were Charles Sterling; J.S. De Bevoise 1891; and J. De Bevoise, in 1896. John Boss was an occupant in 1922. The house was demolished in 1924.

1922
Views 1,2,3 and 4

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

727399f-b.text:
Metropolitan Avenue, north side, east of Seventy-first Avenue, showing in two views the old and the new De Bevoise house.  The new house was erected about 1890 and is on the site of the old house which was moved further west.  The old house was demolished in 1924; the new house is not standing in 1929. View No. 1 also shows the rears of a group of houses on the south side of Nansen Street, between Seventy-first and Forty-second [transcriber's note: should read "Seventy-second", not "Forty-second"] Avenues.

March 31, 1924
View 2: Oct. 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

[Transcriber's note: View No. 1 appears to show the new house at the far right of the picture.  If that is the case, and the description is correct, then the new house is located between 71st Ave. and 72nd Ave., and possibly closer to 72nd Ave.]
